amiller.colormap
Class ColorMap

java.lang.Object
  amiller.colormap.ColorMap
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColorMapSequence, ParametricColorMap, TwoColorBlend
public abstract class ColorMap
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a function over [0,1] that generates an ordered list of colors.

static int LOGARITHMIC

normalize

public double normalize(int index)
Maps an integer value in [0, 255] to a double in [0.0, 1.0]

denormalize

public int denormalize(double index)
Maps a double value in [0.0, 1.0] to an integer in [0, 255]

narrow

public double narrow(double index)
Ensures that the index is in [0,1]. Values less than 0 are mapped to 0 and those greater than 1 are mapped to 1.

colorList

public java.util.List colorList(int length)
Returns a list of colors computed using this colormap and the default mapping.

Parameters:
length - The length of the list.

colorList

public java.util.List colorList(int length,
                                int mapping)
Returns a list of colors computed using this colormap (useful when computing a color value is expensive).

Parameters:
length - The length of the list.
mapping - One of ColorMap.LINEAR or ColorMap.LOGARITHMIC.

reverse

public ColorMap reverse()
Returns the reverse of this colormap. The reverse remains dependent on this colormap, thus changes to this will have the corresponding effect on the reverse.
